ANSWER.TO.QON.TITLE: Department of Tourism: Ministerial Equipment and Facilities

TALK.START.PARA: asked the Minister representing the the Minister for Tourism, upon notice, on 8 December 1992:

PARA.TAB: With reference to each of the personnel listed below:
The Minister
The Minister's ministerial staff
The Minister's electorate staff
Department liaison officers
Consultants employed in the Minister's office
Any combination thereof
(1) What are the details of purchases of office equipment, facilities and services by the department, since the last Federal election, for the use of each listed person or group.

(2) What are the details of the date of purchase, leasing or otherwise acquiring each individual item (for example, each mobile telephone, each airline lounge membership etcetera) and the make and model of each individual item or the specific nature and level of the facility or service provided.
(3) What is the position, salary level and status of the person (Minister, consultant, ministerial staff or electorate staff) in receipt of each item of office equipment, facility or service.
(4) What was the initial and/or establishment cost of each item, facility or service.
(5) What are the on-going operating costs of each item, facility or service (for example, lease payments, telephone bills, maintenance costs, stationery, etcetera).
(6) What are the specific details of the assets register in which each item of office equipment and each facility or service is listed.
(7) How often are stocktakes on `personal issue' items conducted and what follow-up action has been initiated for items not located, or damaged.
(8) What controls are placed on `personal issue' items to ensure that they are not used for personal use or in any other fraudulent manner.

(9) What are the above details with regard to the purchase of any office equipment, facilities or services which are not normally available to non-ministerial electorate staff under Department of Administrative Services guidelines, including: (a) mobile telephones, laptop computers and pagers; (b) airline lounge memberships; (c) telephone services, photocopiers, personal computers and accompanying hardware and software, facsimile machines, dictaphones (or similar recording devices), television sets, video recorders, cassette radios and document shredders installed in the Minister's offices and/or at the home addresses or any person in the categories listed above; (d) Australian Government credit cards, Cabcharge cards, Telecom credit cards, or other credit cards and accounts; and newspapers, periodicals; and (e) other published material.
(10) In each case where electorate staff, as opposed to ministerial staff, are provided with any of the above items, what are the reasons for the provision of those items by the department.

(11) Will the Minister provide an undertaking that any office equipment, facilities or services that are currently provided under such arrangements will (a) not be used for election and campaign purposes from the date the election is called; and (b) be promptly returned to the appropriate department if the Australian Labor Party is not returned to Government in the Federal election.

TALK.START.PARA: —The Minister for Tourism has provided the following answer to the honourable senator's question:

PARA.TAB: (1) The Department of Tourism, via the Department of Primary Industries and Energy, provides my Office with any office equipment, facilities and services required in addition to those provided by the Department of Administrative Services. These include:
Production of Publications
General Printing
Purchase of Publications, Books, Journals and Newspapers
Video Production
Stores and Consumables
Machine Operating Costs
Minor Repairs and Maintenance
Freight and Courier
Postage
Semi-Official Telephones
Mobile Telephones
Other Communication Costs
Purchase of Computers, Software, Office Machines and Office Furniture

Provision of the above via the Department of Primary Industries and Energy is in line with a cost sharing arrangement for the operation of my office, signed by the Department of Tourism and the Department of Primary Industries and Energy in March 1992. Under this arrangement the two Departments share equally the running and operational costs, with the exception of Departmental Liaison Officers salaries and linkages necessary for departmental operations, of my office. The Department of Primary Industries and Energy is responsible for all administration arrangements and seeks reimbursement from the Department of Tourism on a quarterly basis.

(2)-(5) The Department does not have the detailed information readily available to adequately reply to this question and I am not prepared to authorise the time and resources entailed in collecting the information.

(6) Assets held in the Ministers' offices are recorded in the Ministerial Coordination Division, Department of Primary Industries and Energy assets register. Each item having a value of $2,000 or more, and any item that is deemed to be portable and attractive, is included in the register. Services and other facilities are recorded within the Department's financial management system. Recording of assets on the Department of Primary Industries and Energy register is in line with the cost sharing arrangement referred to in the answer to question 1.

(7) A stocktake of all assets is carried out at least annually by the Department of Primary Industries and Energy, in accordance with their Secretary's Instructions No. 1 and 2. Any discrepancies relating to the Ministers' offices that become apparent during the stocktake process are investigated by the Ministerial Coordination Division, Department of Primary Industries and Energy.Any items on personal issue are recovered from staff upon cessation of employment.
(8) These items are issued for official use only. Users are required to adhere to relevant guidelines and directions which are drawn to their attention when issued with the items.

(9) The Department does not have the detailed information readily available to adequately reply to this question and I am not prepared to authorise the time and resources entailed in collecting the information.
(10) Electorate staff are not provided with any office equipment, facilities or services which are not normally available under Department of Administrative Services guidelines.

(11) (a) Facilities provided in all Ministers' offices by Departments remain available for use during any election period as do facilities provided by the Department of Administrative Services in the offices of Ministers, Opposition office holders and other Members and Senators. In line with the cost sharing arrangements referred to in the answer to question 1 Department of Primary Industries and Energy staff regularly examine requests, for what might be seen as inappropriate support or requests, and judge these in accordance with the Guidelines on Official Conduct of Public Servants.
(b) Yes.
